headlines: RAIL EXECUTIVES CHARGED IN FRAUD SCHEME
DOJ CHARGES 6 IN CRYPTO FRAUD TARGETING VETS
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm Marcus Webb here with Patricia Holt. The Environmental Protection Agency has ordered emergency water testing in six Michigan communities after Wayne State University researchers detected unusual bacterial levels in municipal water supplies.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks Marcus. The Department of Justice has charged six people in a cryptocurrency fraud scheme that targeted military veterans across seventeen states. Officials say the sophisticated operation defrauded service members of significant amounts.

[ANCHOR_A] Patricia, federal prosecutors in Denver have also charged four Consolidated Rail Associates executives with conspiracy to defraud the Department of Transportation of nearly eighty million dollars in infrastructure funds.

[ANCHOR_B] And the Federal Aviation Administration has ordered immediate inspections of all Boeing seven-thirty-seven dash eight-hundred aircraft after discovering potential structural cracks in wing components. The directive affects hundreds of planes nationwide.

[ANCHOR_A] Finally tonight, the State Department announced new sanctions against twelve Chinese technology firms accused of supporting military surveillance programs. Secretary of State Marco Rubio cited national security concerns in the decision. I'm Marcus Webb.

[ANCHOR_B] And I'm Patricia Holt. We'll be back with more This News Now at the top of the hour.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: A severe winter storm system is forecast to bring up to eighteen inches of snow and ICE to portions of six Midwestern states beginning Thursday night. The National Weather Service has issued blizzard warnings from Kansas City to Detroit, with winds expected to reach sixty miles per hour. [CHYRON: MAJOR WINTER STORM TARGETS MIDWEST] [B-ROLL: Weather maps showing storm track, snow plows preparing] Chicago's O'Hare Airport has already cancelled four hundred flights. We'll track this storm tonight.
broll_descriptions: Weather maps showing storm track, snow plows preparing

data.script: The Pentagon announced today it will close three military bases in Alabama and Texas by twenty-twenty-six, affecting nearly eight thousand personnel and their families. Defense Secretary officials cited budget constraints and shifting strategic priorities as primary factors. [CHYRON: PENTAGON TO CLOSE 3 BASES BY 2026] [B-ROLL: Military personnel walking near base entrance gates] Base commanders at Fort Riverside and Camp Henderson expressed disappointment but pledged full cooperation with the transition timeline. Local communities are bracing for significant economic impact. We'll have more details after this break.
broll_descriptions: Military personnel walking near base entrance gates

data.script: The Federal Trade Commission has blocked a proposed twelve billion dollar merger between Midwest telecom giant Heartland Communications and regional competitor Prairie Networks, citing anti-competitive concerns in rural markets across six states. [CHYRON: FTC BLOCKS $12B TELECOM MERGER] FTC Commissioner Sarah Chen called the deal a threat to broadband competition in underserved communities. [B-ROLL: FTC headquarters building, rural cell towers] Both companies say they will appeal the decision. More on this story ahead.
broll_descriptions: FTC headquarters building, rural cell towers

data.script: The Department of Energy has announced sweeping cuts to renewable energy grants, eliminating funding for over forty solar and wind projects across twelve states. Energy Secretary nominee Rebecca Torres defended the decision, citing budget constraints and shifting priorities toward domestic oil production. [CHYRON: DOE CUTS RENEWABLE ENERGY FUNDING] [B-ROLL: Solar panel installation, wind turbines spinning] The cuts will affect projects in Texas, California, and Colorado, potentially eliminating three thousand jobs. Environmental groups are threatening legal action. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Solar panel installation, wind turbines spinning

data.script: The Federal Aviation Administration has ordered immediate inspections of all Boeing 737-800 aircraft following the discovery of potential structural cracks in wing components. The directive affects shift amps hundred planes operated by major US carriers. Aviation safety expert Dr. Marcus Chen warns the defects could compromise flight stability under extreme weather conditions. [CHYRON: FAA ORDERS BOEING 737-800 INSPECTIONS] [B-ROLL: Boeing aircraft on tarmac, maintenance crews examining wing sections] Airlines have seventy-two hours to complete the checks. More details after this break.
broll_descriptions: Boeing aircraft on tarmac, maintenance crews examining wing sections

data.script: The State Department announced new sanctions against twelve Chinese technology firms accused of supporting military surveillance programs in disputed territories. Secretary of State Marco Rubio called the measures necessary to protect regional allies from what he termed systematic espionage operations. [CHYRON: US SANCTIONS 12 CHINESE TECH FIRMS] [B-ROLL: State Department briefing room, officials at podium] Beijing condemned the action as economic coercion and threatened retaliatory measures bath master companies operating in China. More developments expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: State Department briefing room, officials at podium

data.script: The Department of Homeland Security announced sweeping changes to visa processing procedures for six countries, citing national security concerns. The new protocols will require additional screening for applicants from Brazil, Indonesia, Nigeria, Pakistan, Philippines, and Vietnam starting April first. [CHYRON: DHS TIGHTENS VISA SCREENING FOR SIX NATIONS] Homeland Security Secretary Thomas Hayes called the measures necessary but temporary. Immigration attorneys warn of massive processing delays. [B-ROLL: Visa application center, long lines of applicants] More details ahead after the break.
chyrons: DHS TIGHTENS VISA SCREENING FOR SIX NATIONS
broll_descriptions: Visa application center, long lines of applicants

data.script: The Department of Justice announced charges against six individuals in connection with a sophisticated cryptocurrency fraud scheme that targeted military veterans across seventeen states. Assistant Attorney General Michael Chen said the operation promised guaranteed returns on digital currency investments but instead diverted over forty million dollars to overseas accounts. [CHYRON: DOJ CHARGES 6 IN CRYPTO FRAUD TARGETING VETS] [B-ROLL: DOJ press conference, cryptocurrency trading screens] More than three thousand veterans lost their savings. Sentencing could bring twenty years in federal prison.
chyrons: DOJ CHARGES 6 IN CRYPTO FRAUD TARGETING VETS
broll_descriptions: DOJ press conference, cryptocurrency trading screens

data.script: The Department of Energy announced it will terminate funding for three advanced battery research projects at universities in California, citing budget constraints and shifting priorities toward domestic mineral extraction. [CHYRON: DOE CUTS UNIVERSITY BATTERY RESEARCH] The decision affects the scent of graduate students and postdoctoral researchers across Stanford, UC Berkeley, and Caltech. [B-ROLL: Laboratory equipment, researchers in white coats] Project directors called the cuts shortsighted given China's dominance in battery technology. More on this developing story after the break.
broll_descriptions: Laboratory equipment, researchers in white coats

data.script: Federal prosecutors in Denver have charged four executives from Consolidated Rail Associates with conspiracy to defraud the Department of Transportation of nearly eighty million dollars in infrastructure grants. The indictment alleges the company submitted false safety certifications for rail projects across Colorado and Wyoming between 2019 and 2023. [CHYRON: RAIL EXECUTIVES CHARGED IN FRAUD SCHEME] [B-ROLL: Federal courthouse steps, DOT investigators with boxes of evidence] Company stock plummeted eighteen percent in after-hours trading. More developments expected tomorrow.
chyrons: RAIL EXECUTIVES CHARGED IN FRAUD SCHEME
broll_descriptions: Federal courthouse steps, DOT investigators with boxes of evidence

data.script: The Department of Education announced today it will withhold nearly forty million dollars in federal funding from Bellhaven Public Schools after auditors discovered systematic grade inflation affecting over eight thousand students. Education Secretary Miguel Cardona called the Virginia district's practices "a betrayal of academic integrity." [CHYRON: FEDS WITHHOLD $40M FROM BELLHAVEN SCHOOLS] [B-ROLL: Empty school hallways, students walking between classes] Superintendent Rachel Torres denied wrongdoing but resigned effective immediately. The district has thirty days to appeal.
broll_descriptions: Empty school hallways, students walking between classes

data.script: The Environmental Protection Agency has ordered emergency water testing in six Michigan communities after researchers at Wayne State University detected unusual bacterial levels in municipal supplies near Lake Huron. [CHYRON: EPA ORDERS MICHIGAN WATER TESTING] EPA regional director Sarah Kellerman said initial findings warrant immediate investigation, though no illnesses have been reported. [B-ROLL: Water treatment facility, laboratory technicians testing samples] Residents in affected areas are advised to boil water until further notice. More details expected tomorrow.
broll_descriptions: Water treatment facility, laboratory technicians testing samples
